p: Based on the full-length VP1 amino acid sequence, NoVs are classified into at least eight genogroups (GI to GVIII) and >40 genotypes [ 37]. Only GI, GII, GIV, and GVIII NoVs infect humans, with GII.4 strains that are the most prevalent worldwide [ 31]. NoVs detected in animals have been classified as GII (pigs) [ 38], GIII (small and large domestic ruminants) [ 39, 40], GIV (lion, dog, cat) [ 11, 25, 26], GV (mice) [ 41], GVI (dog, cat) [ 42, 43] and GVII [ 44].
